alert.note: Alert for Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 6:01PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fergus County through 630 PM MDT... At 559 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles west of Flatwillow, or 23 miles northwest of Roundup, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail, along with heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Fergus County. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 122 and 123. Highway 191 between mile markers 27 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to minor localized flooding of roads, small creeks, and low-lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
